alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains Foothills; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Lower Brewster County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 16 at 1:53PM CDT until July 17 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 104 in the mountains and foothills and up to 114 in Lower Brewster County. * WHERE...Guadalupe Mountains above 7000 feet, Davis Mountain Foothills, and Lower Brewster County. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ Monday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains Foothills; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Lower Brewster County
